main event: On 4 November 1956 in Wilmington, Delaware, a civilian observed four unidentified objects, the size of peas, displaying diamond-shaped lights reflecting from an aircraft wing. The objects disappeared after being observed visually for five seconds, straight up, and at 35 to 45 degrees azimuth.
interesting points: The objects were described as the size of peas, indicating their small apparent size.
The lights on the objects were diamond-shaped and appeared to be reflected from an aircraft wing.
The objects disappeared immediately after being observed for five seconds, suggesting rapid movement or disappearance.
The observation was conducted by a civilian and lasted only five seconds, providing a brief but intriguing sighting.
Weather and wind conditions at the time of the sighting were reported as clear, with bright stars and no clouds, ruling out potential natural phenomena.
sighted object: four unidentified objects with diamond-shaped lights
